intro: Delphinium bulleyanum, commonly known as the Bulleyan delphinium, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces tall, slender stems adorned with clusters of striking blue to purple flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are composed of five petals, with the upper petal often being larger and more showy. Delphinium bulleyanum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
